Package org.jtrim2.access

Class HierarchicalRight

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.access.HierarchicalRight
public final class HierarchicalRight extends Object
Defines hierarchically structured rights defined by list of right objects. The list of objects are said to be the parts of the right and these rights can be any objects (even null) but are strongly recommended to be immutable. This list completely defines a hierarchical right.

A right starting with the same list (using Objects.equals(Object, Object) for comparing the right parts) as the complete list of right parts of another right is said to be a subright of the latter right. Notice that by this definition a right is always a subright of itself. And every hierarchical right is the subright of the right with an empty list of right parts (the universal right).

Two hierarchical right are said to be conflicting if and only if one of the right is subright of the other one.

This class does not have a public constructor and can only be initiated by one of its factory methods:

  • create
  • createFromList

Thread safety

Instances of this class are immutable and as such are thread-safe even in the face of unsynchronized concurrent access. Note that although instances are immutable, the right parts may not be immutable themselves but it is strongly recommended to use immutable right parts.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.
See Also:
  • HierarchicalAccessManager

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static HierarchicalRight create(Object... rights)
      Creates a hierarchical right from an array of right parts. The returned hierarchical right will contain the specified right parts in the order they appear in the array.
      Parameters:
      rights - the right parts. This argument can be specified as a varargs argument and cannot be null (although the individual elements can be nulls).
      Returns:
      the hierarchical right defined by the specified list of right parts. This method never returns null but not necessarily returns a unique object for each call.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the argument is null

    • createFromList

      public static HierarchicalRight createFromList(List<?> rights)
      Creates a hierarchical right from an list of right parts. The returned hierarchical right will contain the specified right parts in the order they appear in the list.
      Parameters:
      rights - the list right parts. This argument cannot be null (although the individual elements can be nulls).
      Returns:
      the hierarchical right defined by the specified list of right parts. This method never returns null but not necessarily returns a unique object for each call.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the argument is null

    • readRequest

      public static <IDType> AccessRequest<IDType,HierarchicalRight> readRequest(IDType requestID, Object... rights)
      Returns an AccessRequest containing a single HierarchicalRight as a read right.
      Type Parameters:
      IDType - the type of the request id
      Parameters:
      requestID - the request id of the returned AccessRequest. This argument cannot be null.
      rights - the right parts of the HierarchicalRight contained by the returned AccessRequest. This argument cannot be null (although the individual elements can be nulls).
      Returns:
      an AccessRequest containing a single HierarchicalRight as a read right. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - throw if the specified requestID or the array of right parts is null

    • writeRequest

      public static <IDType> AccessRequest<IDType,HierarchicalRight> writeRequest(IDType requestID, Object... rights)
      Returns an AccessRequest containing a single HierarchicalRight as a write right.
      Type Parameters:
      IDType - the type of the request id
      Parameters:
      requestID - the request id of the returned AccessRequest. This argument cannot be null.
      rights - the right parts of the HierarchicalRight contained by the returned AccessRequest. This argument cannot be null (although the individual elements can be nulls).
      Returns:
      an AccessRequest containing a single HierarchicalRight as a write right. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - throw if the specified requestID or the array of right parts is null

    • getRights

      public List<Object> getRights()
      Returns an unmodifiable list of the right parts of this hierarchical right. The returned list will contain the elements in order.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of the right parts of this hierarchical right. This method never returns null but may return an empty list if this right is the universal right.

    • isUniversal

      public boolean isUniversal()
      Return true if this right is the universal right. The universal right conflicts with every hierarchical right (including itself) and has zero right parts.
      Returns:
      true if this right is the universal right, false otherwise

    • isChildRightOf

      public boolean isChildRightOf(HierarchicalRight right)
      Returns true if this right is the subright of the specified right. That is the right parts of the specified hierarchical right begins with the right parts of this hierarchical right (using Objects.equals(Object, Object) for comparing the right parts.
      Parameters:
      right - the specified hierarchical right which to which this right is tested to be its subright. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      true if this right is the subright of the specified right, false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the argument is null

    • getParentRight

      public HierarchicalRight getParentRight(int index)
      Returns a parent right of this right. The right parts of the specified will be the same as the first requested number of parts of this hierarchical right.

      This right is always the subright of the returned right.

      Parameters:
      index - index + 1 number of right parts will be removed from the end of the right part list of this hierarchical right unless this number is higher (or equal) to the number of right parts this hierarchical right has: in which case the universal right is returned.
      Returns:
      the requested parent right of this right. This method never returns null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - thrown if index is a negative integer

    • getParentRight

      public HierarchicalRight getParentRight()
      Returns the parent right of this hierarchical right. This method call is equivalent to getParentRight(0).
      Returns:
      the requested parent right of this right. This method never returns null. This method returns the universal right for the universal right.

    • getChildRight

      public Object getChildRight()
      Returns the last element of the right part list of this hierarchical right. The result is the same as getRights().get(getRights().size - 1) except for the universal right.
      Returns:
      the last element of the right part list of this hierarchical right. This method can return null if the last element is actually null.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - thrown if this right is the universal right

    • createSubRight

      public HierarchicalRight createSubRight(Object... subRights)
      Creates a subright of this HierarchicalRight appending the given right parts to it. The newly created instance will have a right list which right parts are the concatenation of the right parts of this HierarchicalRight and the specified right parts.
      Parameters:
      subRights - the last elements of the right part list of the newly created hierarchical right. This argument can be null.
      Returns:
      the subright of this HierarchicalRight with the given right parts appended. This method never returns null but not necessarily returns a unique object for each call.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if the parentRight is null

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Checks whether this right is the same hierarchical right as the object specified. Two hierarchical right is considered equal if their right list part is the same using Objects.equals(Object, Object) for comparing the right parts.

      This method will return false for every object that is not an instance of HierarchicalRight.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the right to which this right is to be compared. This argument can be null in which case false is returned.
      Returns:
      true if the specified hierarchical right is the same right as this right, false otherwise

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the string representation of this hierarchical right in no particular format. The string representation will contain the right parts of this hierarchical right in order.

      This method is intended to be used for debugging only.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the string representation of this object in no particular format. This method never returns null.
